analytics.urls module#

analytics.v_api module#

analytics.v_api.GET_get_analytics_in_team(request, cur_user, cur_team, cur_season)#

Return JsonResponse which contains dictionary with players. Each object is a dictionary, where the key is what we consider, and the value, respectively, is its value. Use cached data (stored at Database), if this data was expired by CACHE_EXPIRES_SECS, then server calculates actual values.

Parameters:

  • request ([HttpRequest]) – Django HttpRequest.

  • cur_user (Model.object[User]) – The current user of the system, who is currently authorized.

  • cur_team ([int]) – The current team, that is selected by the user.

  • cur_season ([int]) – Current season’s ID.

Returns:

JsonResponse with “data”, “success” flag (True or False) and “status” (response code). “Data” example: {

’players’: {
‘[player_id -> int]’: {

‘matches_count: 0, ‘matches_time: 0, ‘matches_goals: 0, …

}

}

Return type:

JsonResponse[{“data”: [obj], “success”: [bool]}, status=[int]]

analytics.v_api.POST_edit_analytics(request, cur_user, cur_team)#

Template POST API FUNC

analytics.v_api.check_protocol_status(status)#

Return True or False, if tag “analytics” is 1 in status, then True, else False.

Parameters:

status (Model.object[PlayerProtocolStatus]) – Protocol status.

Returns:

If tag “analytics” is 1 in status, then True, else False.

Return type:

[bool]

analytics.v_api.get_by_language_code(value, code)#

Return a value by current language’s code.

Parameters:

  • value (dict[str]) – Dictionary with structure(“code_1”: “value_1”,…) for different languages. Usually “value” is STRING.

  • code ([str]) – String key of any language. For example: “engilsh” -> “en”, “russian” -> “ru”.

Raises:

None. In case of an exception, the result – “”. If it was not possible to find the desired value by the key, then an attempt will be made to take the default (LANG_CODE_DEFAULT).

Returns:

Value, depending on the current language.

Return type:

[str]

analytics.v_api.get_exs_folders(cur_user, cur_team)#

Return a list of Model.UserFolder or Model.ClubFolder depending on current version.

Parameters:

  • cur_user (Model.object[User]) – The current user of the system, who is currently authorized.

  • cur_team ([int]) – The current team, that is selected by the user.

Raises:

None. In case of any error, the result – [].

Returns:

Empty list or list of exercises’ folders.

Return type:

list[Model.object[UserFolder]]

analytics.v_api.get_season_months(request, season)#

Return list of objects, which contains full name of month and short 3 letter word. Names of months selected by current system’s language.

Parameters:

  • request ([HttpRequest]) – Django HttpRequest.

  • season ([int]) – Season’s ID.

Raises:

None. In case of any error, result – [].

Returns:

List of current selected season’s months. (Example: [{‘name’: “January”, ‘short’: “Jan”},…]) or empty list

Return type:

list[{‘name’: [str], ‘short’: [str]}]

analytics.v_api.months_between(start_date, end_date)#

Return every first day of the month from start date to end date as DATE. Using yield.

Parameters:

  • start_date ([date]) – Start date of required range.

  • end_date ([date]) – End date of required range.

Raises:

AttributeError. In case "start_date" or "end_date" not DATE, result – exception.

Returns:

Every first day of the month from start date to end date.

Return type:

yield[date]

analytics.views module#

analytics.views.analytics(request)#
Return render page with given template.

If the user is not authorized, then there will be a redirect to the page with authorization.

Parameters:

request ([HttpRequest]) – Django HttpRequest.

Returns:

Return an HttpResponse whose content is filled with the result of calling django.template.loader.render_to_string() with the passed arguments.

Next arguments:

  • ‘refs’ -> References of Analytics Section.

  • ‘folders’ -> UserFolder or ClubFolder objects filtered by user and current team.

  • ‘months’ -> List of current season’s months.

  • ‘seasons_list’ -> List of user’s or club’s seasons available current user.

  • ‘teams_list’ -> List of user’s or club’s teams available current user.

  • ‘ui_elements’ -> List of UI elements registered in icons’ system. Check Module.system_icons.views.get_ui_elements(request) for see more.

Return type:

[HttpResponse]

analytics.views.analytics_api(request)#
Return JsonResponse depending on the request method and the parameter sent.

If the user is not authorized, then there will be a redirect to the page with authorization. In case of any error client will get next response: JsonResponse({“errors”: “access_error”}, status=400).

Existing parameteres (Controlling Variable for any parameter is: ‘parameter’_status):

  • ‘get_analytics_all’ -> Getting analytics for the selected season, for the current team and additionally for a specific period of time. Check analytics.v_api.GET_get_analytics_in_team() for see more.

  • ‘edit_analytics’ -> None

Parameters:

request ([HttpRequest]) – Django HttpRequest.

Returns:

Return an JsonResponse with next parameteres:

  • ‘errors’ -> Error text in case getting any error.

  • ‘status’ -> Response code.

  • ‘data’ -> Requiered data depending on the request method and the parameter sent, if status code is OK.

Return type:

[JsonResponse]
